Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs
Artus, Charlotte M.
Artus, Edward A.
Spencer, Nancy
2010.010
0.01 Linear Feet in one folder.
1920-1940 The Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs span from 1920 to 1940 depict the Artus family's connection to their friends and relatives, as well as their summer retreats and outdoor recreation at various parks and beaches in Long Island and New Jersey. Edward A. Artus (1896-1973) was a machinist born and raised in Brooklyn. He met Charlotte at the National Biscuit Company and the couple married in 1921. The family later moved to New Jersey in the 1930s with their daughter Mildred. A0124
Arrangement
Arranged in chronologically.
Biographical note
Edward A. Artus (1896-1973) was a machinist born and raised in Brooklyn. Edward met Charlotte Marie (Kirschenheiter) Artus (1892-1971) at the National Biscuit Company, whom he later married in 1921. After their marriage, Charlotte became a housewife and began taking care of their daughter, Mildred L. Artus (1922-1975). The family moved to New Jersey in the 1930s. The family often spend their summer at camps and beaches with their relatives and friends on Long Island and New Jersey.
Source: New York Family Group Sheet for the Edward August Artus Family. http://www.fgs-project.com/newyork/groups/a/artus-edward-august.html
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
Reproduction rights for photographs have not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Nancy Spencer, 2010.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs, 2010.010, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the collection level.
Content Description
The Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs consist of 57 black-and-white photographs of a family who resided in Brooklyn, New York and New Jersey, dating from 1920 to 1940. The photographs depict the family home in Woodhaven (Queens), family retreats, and outdoor recreation activities at Jones Beach, Heckscher State Park, and Edgewater Camp.
